Class CryptUtil

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.crypt.CryptUtil
public final class CryptUtil extends Object
Cryptographic utilities.

  • Method Details

    • encryptSymmetric

      public static byte[] encryptSymmetric(Key key, byte[] data, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Symmetrically encrypt data using a Key object with the default algorithm.
      Parameters:
      key - the encryption key (must be compatible with the algorithm)
      data - the data to encrypt
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      the encrypted message as byte array
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if encryption fails

    • encryptSymmetric

      public static byte[] encryptSymmetric(SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, Key key, byte[] data, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Symmetrically encrypt data using a Key object with the specified algorithm.
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the symmetric algorithm to use
      key - the encryption key (must be compatible with the algorithm)
      data - the data to encrypt
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      the encrypted message as byte array
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if encryption fails

    • encrypt

      public static String encrypt(byte[] input, char[] password, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling)
      Encrypts the provided input data using AES encryption with a password-based key derivation. The method generates a random salt, derives a secret key using the provided password, and encrypts the input data. The result is a Base64-encoded string containing the salt and the encrypted data, separated by a "$" character.

      The password must have at least 8 characters.

      Parameters:
      input - the data to be encrypted, represented as a byte array
      password - the password used to derive the encryption key, represented as a char array
      inputBufferHandling - specifies how the method should handle the input buffer after encryption; it determines whether to preserve or clear the input
      Returns:
      a Base64-encoded string containing the salt and the encrypted data, separated by a "$" character
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the encryption process encounters a general security exception

    • decrypt

      public static byte[] decrypt(String input, char[] password)
      Decrypts the given input string using the specified password and input buffer handling strategy.

      The input string should be in a specific format with a delimiter ('$') separating the salt and the encrypted data. The method extracts the salt and the encrypted data from the input string, derives a key using the provided password and salt, and then decrypts the encrypted data.

      The password must have at least 8 characters.

      Parameters:
      input - the encrypted string, which should contain a salt and encrypted data separated by a '$' character
      password - the password to derive the decryption key
      Returns:
      the decrypted data as a byte array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input string is invalid in format or there is no '$' delimiter
      IllegalStateException - if decryption fails due to cryptographic errors

    • decryptSymmetric

      public static byte[] decryptSymmetric(SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm, Key key, byte[] cipherMessage) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Symmetrically decrypt data using a Key object with the specified algorithm.

      Note: decryption methods to not take an InputBufferHandling argument since the encrypted data is not considered security sensitive.

      Parameters:
      algorithm - the symmetric algorithm that was used for encryption
      key - the encryption key (must be compatible with the algorithm)
      cipherMessage - the encrypted data
      Returns:
      the decrypted message as a byte array
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if decryption fails

    • decryptSymmetric

      public static byte[] decryptSymmetric(Key key, byte[] cipherMessage) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Symmetrically decrypt data using a Key object with the default algorithm.

      The data is decrypted using AES-GCM.

      Note: decryption methods to not take an InputBufferHandling argument since the encrypted data is not considered security sensitive.

      Parameters:
      key - the encryption key (must be compatible with the algorithm)
      cipherMessage - the encrypted data
      Returns:
      the decrypted message as a byte array
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if decryption fails

    • encryptHybrid

      public static byte[] encryptHybrid(PublicKey publicKey, byte[] data, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Hybrid encryption for large data using RSA/EC for key encryption and AES-GCM for data encryption.

      This method generates a random AES key, encrypts the data with AES-GCM, then encrypts the AES key with the provided public key using asymmetric encryption. The result combines both the encrypted AES key and the encrypted data in a single byte array.

      Format: [4 bytes: encrypted key length][encrypted AES key][encrypted data]

      Parameters:
      publicKey - the public key for encrypting the AES key (RSA, EC, or ECIES)
      data - the data to encrypt
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      the hybrid encrypted data as a byte array
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if encryption fails

    • validateAsymmetricEncryptionKey

      public static void validateAsymmetricEncryptionKey(PublicKey key, int dataLength) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Validates the provided asymmetric encryption key to ensure it satisfies the requirements for encrypting data of the specified length.

      This method performs validation specific to the algorithm of the key. For RSA keys, it ensures that the data length does not exceed the maximum allowed size based on the key's modulus and padding restrictions.

      Parameters:
      key - the asymmetric encryption key to validate
      dataLength - the length of the data that is intended to be encrypted
      Throws:
      InvalidKeyException - if the algorithm doesn't support direct encryption
      IllegalBlockSizeException - if the data is too large for the key/algorithm
      GeneralSecurityException

    • encryptAsymmetric

      public static byte[] encryptAsymmetric(PublicKey publicKey, byte[] data, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Asymmetrically encrypt data using a public key.
      Parameters:
      publicKey - the public key for encryption
      data - the data to encrypt
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      the encrypted data
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if encryption fails

    • decryptHybrid

      public static byte[] decryptHybrid(PrivateKey privateKey, byte[] cipherData) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Decrypt hybrid encrypted data using the corresponding private key.

      This method reverses the hybrid encryption process by first extracting and decrypting the AES key using the private key, then using that AES key to decrypt the actual data.

      Note: decryption methods to not take an InputBufferHandling argument since the encrypted data is not considered security sensitive.

      Parameters:
      privateKey - the private key corresponding to the public key used for encryption
      cipherData - the hybrid encrypted data as a byte array
      Returns:
      the decrypted data
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if decryption fails

    • decryptAsymmetric

      public static byte[] decryptAsymmetric(PrivateKey privateKey, byte[] cipherData) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Asymmetrically decrypt data using a private key.

      Note: decryption methods to not take an InputBufferHandling argument since the encrypted data is not considered security sensitive.

      Parameters:
      privateKey - the private key for decryption
      cipherData - the encrypted data
      Returns:
      the decrypted data
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if decryption fails

    • hmacSha256

      public static String hmacSha256(SecretKey key, CharSequence s) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeyException
      Computes an HMAC using the SHA-256 algorithm of the provided input.

      This method normalizes the text before creating the HMAC like this: - unicode normalization - conversion of line ends to '\n'

      It does not: - trim the text - convert it to lowercase

      Note: The key size must be at least 256 bits.

      Parameters:
      key - the secret key to use for HMAC generation
      s - the input data
      Returns:
      the computed HMAC as a hexadecimal string
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the SHA-256 algorithm is not supported
      InvalidKeyException - if the provided secret key is invalid

    • hmacSha256

      public static String hmacSha256(SecretKey key, char[] s) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeyException
      Computes an HMAC using the SHA-256 algorithm of the provided input.

      This method calls hmacSha256(SecretKey, CharSequence).

      Parameters:
      key - the secret key to use for HMAC generation
      s - the input data
      Returns:
      the computed HMAC as a hexadecimal string
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the SHA-256 algorithm is not supported
      InvalidKeyException - if the provided secret key is invalid

    • emailHash

      public static byte[] emailHash(CharSequence email, String pepper) throws IllegalStateException
      Generates a hash for the given email representing the Argon2id hash of the normalized email, using a salt derived from HMAC(email, pepper), and the pepper as an Argon2id secret.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address to be hashed; it will be normalized before the hashing process
      pepper - the secret key used for the HMAC generation; it adds an extra layer of security
      Returns:
      a byte array representing the Argon2id hash of the normalized email combined with the HMAC
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the hash could not be generated.

    • secureHash

      public static byte[] secureHash(byte[] input, String pepper) throws IllegalStateException
      Generates a secure hash for the given input using a combination of HMAC-SHA256 and Argon2id. A pepper value is used to enhance the security.
      Parameters:
      input - The input data to be hashed, represented as a byte array.
      pepper - A string value used as a cryptographic key for generating the HMAC-SHA256 hash. This enhances the overall security of the hashing process.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the resulting hash generated after applying Argon2id to the input and the HMAC-derived salt.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the hash could not be generated.

    • getArgon2idBytes

      public static byte[] getArgon2idBytes(byte[] input, byte[] salt, String pepper)
      Generates a derived key using the Argon2id hashing algorithm. This method combines the provided input, salt, and pepper to produce a secure byte array.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - The input byte array to be hashed.
      salt - The salt byte array to be used in the hashing process for added security.
      pepper - A string value used as an additional secret to strengthen the hash.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the securely hashed result using the Argon2id algorithm.

    • getArgon2idBytes

      public static byte[] getArgon2idBytes(byte[] input, byte[] salt, byte[] secret)
      Generates a 256-bit Argon2id hash based on the provided input, salt, and secret. The salt must be exactly 16 bytes in length; otherwise, an exception is thrown.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - The input byte array to be hashed. Cannot be null.
      salt - The salt used in the hashing process. Must be exactly 16 bytes in length.
      secret - An optional secret used as additional input for the hash. Can be null.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the 256-bit Argon2id hash of the input.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the salt is not 16 bytes in length.

    • getArgon2id

      public static String getArgon2id(String input, SecretKey secretKey)
      Generates an Argon2id hash using the provided input and secret key.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the input string to be hashed
      secretKey - the secret key used in the hashing process
      Returns:
      the generated Argon2id hash as a string

    • getArgon2id

      public static String getArgon2id(byte[] input, SecretKey secretKey)
      Returns a string containing the Argon2id hash and the associated salt, encoded in Base64 format. The hash is computed using the provided input data and secret key, with a randomly generated salt. The salt and hash are concatenated with a "$" delimiter.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the input data to be hashed
      secretKey - the secret key incorporated into the Argon2id hash generation
      Returns:
      a Base64-encoded string containing the salt and the Argon2id hash, separated by "$"

    • getArgon2idBytes

      public static byte[] getArgon2idBytes(byte[] input, byte[] salt, SecretKey secretKey)
      Derives a 256-bit hash using the Argon2id algorithm based on the provided input, salt, and secret key parameters.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the input data to be hashed
      salt - the cryptographic salt to use for the hashing process; must be 16 bytes
      secretKey - the secret key incorporated into the hash generation
      Returns:
      a byte array containing the 256-bit Argon2id hash
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided salt is not 16 bytes long

    • getArgon2id

      public static String getArgon2id(String input, String pepper)
      Generates an Argon2id hash of the given input string using the provided pepper.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the input string to be hashed
      pepper - the pepper value to be used alongside the input for hashing
      Returns:
      the resulting Argon2id hash as a string

    • getArgon2id

      public static String getArgon2id(byte[] input, String pepper)
      Generates an Argon2id hash from the given input using a random salt and the provided pepper. The resulting hash includes the Base64-encoded salt and hash separated by a "$" symbol.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - The input byte array to be hashed.
      pepper - A string used as an additional security parameter in the hash computation.
      Returns:
      A string containing the Base64-encoded salt and hash, separated by a "$".

    • verifyArgon2id

      public static boolean verifyArgon2id(String input, SecretKey secretKey, String saltAndHash)
      Verifies whether the provided input matches the given Argon2id hash.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the plain text input to verify
      secretKey - the secret key used for the verification process
      saltAndHash - the combined salt and hash string to validate against
      Returns:
      true if the input matches the provided hash, otherwise false

    • verifyArgon2id

      public static boolean verifyArgon2id(byte[] input, SecretKey secretKey, String saltAndHash)
      Verifies if the input data, when combined with the provided secret key and salt, produces the same Argon2id hash as the one specified in the saltAndHash string.

      The salt and the expected hash are extracted from the saltAndHash parameter, where they are separated by the '$' delimiter. The method computes the actual Argon2id hash using the provided input data, salt, and secret key, and compares it with the expected hash.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the input data to be hashed
      secretKey - the secret key used in the Argon2id hashing algorithm
      saltAndHash - a string containing the base64-encoded salt and hash, separated by '$'
      Returns:
      true if the computed hash matches the expected hash stored in saltAndHash; false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if saltAndHash has an invalid format

    • verifyArgon2id

      public static boolean verifyArgon2id(byte[] input, byte[] secret, String saltAndHash)
      Verifies the provided input against a given Argon2id hash and salt combination. This method compares the actual Argon2id hash derived from the input, salt, and secret with the expected hash to ensure integrity and authenticity.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - The input data to be verified.
      secret - A secret key used in the Argon2id hash derivation process.
      saltAndHash - A string containing the Base64-encoded salt and hash, delimited by a '$' character. The format of the string must be "salt$hash".
      Returns:
      true if the input data matches the expected hash when processed with the given salt and secret, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the format of the saltAndHash string is invalid.

    • verifyArgon2id

      public static boolean verifyArgon2id(String input, byte[] secret, String saltAndHash)
      Verifies if the input string, along with a secret, matches the provided Argon2id hash. This method uses the Argon2id password hashing algorithm for verification.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the input string to be verified against the provided hash
      secret - a byte array representing the additional secret used for hashing
      saltAndHash - the salt and Argon2id hash to verify the input and secret against
      Returns:
      true if the input and secret match the provided Argon2id hash, false otherwise

    • verifyArgon2id

      public static boolean verifyArgon2id(String input, String pepper, String saltAndHash)
      Verifies if the provided input, combined with a pepper, matches the given Argon2id-derived hash. This method performs validation by combining the input and the pepper with the Argon2id parameters embedded in the provided salt-and-hash string and checks if the input corresponds to the same hash.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the plain text input to verify
      pepper - the additional secret value used to harden the hashing process
      saltAndHash - the combined string of salt and the Argon2id hash to validate against
      Returns:
      true if the provided input and pepper produce the same hash as saltAndHash; false otherwise

    • verifyArgon2id

      public static boolean verifyArgon2id(byte[] input, String pepper, String saltAndHash)
      Verifies an Argon2id hash by comparing the provided input, pepper, and the combined salt and hash string.

      Note: This method requires bouncycastle to be on the classpath.

      Parameters:
      input - the raw input data to be verified, typically a password, as a byte array
      pepper - the secret value added to the input for additional security, as a string
      saltAndHash - the concatenation of the salt and hashed result to be used for verification, as a string
      Returns:
      true if the verification succeeds (i.e., the input matches the hash), false otherwise
